Current ExplorationConfronting displaced populations in the 21st centuryI'm working with scientists, policy makers, and artists to envision better energy futures.

Biography

DEJI BRYCE OLUKOTUN is the author of two novels and his fiction has appeared in five different book collections.

His novel After the Flare won the 2018 Philip K. Dick special citation, and was chosen as one of the best books of 2017 by The Guardian, The Washington Post, Syfy.com, Tor.com, Kirkus Reviews, among others.

His short story Between the Dark and the Dark, published in Lightspeed, was selected by editor Diana Gabaldon for Best American Science Fiction and Fantasy 2020 (Houghton Mifflin Harcourt).

He currently works for the audio technology company Sonos and he is a Future Tense Fellow at New America.

Collections

Deji is proud to have his work included in the following collections.

The Best American Science Fiction and Fantasy 2020Welcome to Dystopia: 45 Visions of What Lies AheadFuture Tense Fiction: Stories of TomorrowInvaders: 22 Tales from the Outer Limits of LiteratureVisions, Ventures, Escape Velocities: A Collection of Space FuturesWatchlist: 32 Stories by Persons of Interest

After The FlareWinner of the 2018 Philip K. Dick
special citation award
After the Flare is a futuristic thriller published by Unnamed Press."The entire novel is spectacularly imagined, well-written, and a pleasure to read. An absorbing novel that explores a compelling, African-centered future world."—Kirkus Reviews
